title.narrative: Integrated mobile outreach response to Cyclone Sagar in Baki and Lughaye Districts, Awdal Region Somaliland

description.narrative: To respond to the tropical cyclone World Vision Somalia (WVS) will focus on providing life-saving humanitarian response to the worst affected districts of Baki and Luhaya, Awdal Region hence contributing to the reduction of mortality and morbidity among the vulnerable populations. The proposed action aims at filling in the gaps of acute care, Primary Health and Maternal Health Care during restoration of HCFs due to the increased humanitarian needs after the vast effects of the emergency. The project will support 8 MCH and 4 mobile health clinics with staffing, training, medical supplies and other operation cost to augment the capacity to address the increasing health needs in the disaster affected communities, especially those in hard-to-reach areas. Hygiene kits will be distributed to mother with malnourished U5 children, consider their susceptibility to disease and malnutrition. Hygiene promotion will be included to promote better hygiene practices and increase awareness on health issues related to sanitation. The effects of the tropical cyclone Sagar on the nutrition status of the affected population still remains a concern as there is foreseen impact on the already high levels of malnutrition in the community. With the damage on economic aspects of the community household food insecurity is evident hence world Vision Somalia will work towards active case finding, identification referral and treatment and management of acutely malnourished children, pregnant amp lactating women (PLWs) in the target population. WVS will build the capacity of CHWs and ensure effective community engagement and participation in active case finding, identification and referral for further management at health care facilities and mobile points. WVS will offer integrated management of acute Malnutrition services which will include OTP services to the severely malnourished beneficiaries, TSFP among the moderately malnourished and linkage to the livelihood projects for enhanced household food security thus contributing to improved nutrition status. Effective surveillance mechanisms will be put in place at community level to monitor any significant outbreaks and deteriorations in the health and nutrition status of the target community. The promotion of appropriate IYCF practices will be conducted both at health facilities and community level to enhance the community’s knowledge, attitude and practice. Community engagement and participation will be a crucial aspect of the proposed action to ensure adoption and ownership of the project by the target population. WVSOM will involve the community through community dialogue meetings, community mobilization, and awareness creation activities to enhance the communities’ health seeking behaviour. The project will also aim at building the capacity of health care workers and community health workers to respond to the emergency. WVSOM will train and provide supportive supervision to the program staff during the implementation period while ensuring all the health and nutrition needs of the affected populations are met. The proposed action will complement the already existing WVI supported projects within Baki and Lughaya. This will be achieved through enhanced integrations and strengthened linkages between different sectors interventions thus increasing resilience. World Vision will implement the proposed project in collaboration with the MOH and other stakeholders within Awdal region to ensure effective integration with other projects including the livelihood, WASH and resilience projects to be able to offer comprehensive services to the affected populations. World Vision will support in coordination of the response initiatives with all the clusters to ensure effective implementation and impact on the affected populations.
